section.heading: Notarization and acknowledgment.
section.text: If a law requires a signature or record to be notarized, acknowledged, verified, or made under oath, the requirement is satisfied if the electronic signature of the person authorized to perform those acts, together with all other information required to be included by other applicable law, is attached to or logically associated with the signature or record.

annoGroup.heading: Effect of Amendments
annoGroup.annotation: D.C. Law 15-105 validated previously made technical corrections.

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see § 3202(b) of Fiscal Year 2002 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2001 (D.C. Act 14-124, August 3, 2001, 48 DCR 7861).

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 11 of the Uniform Electronic Transactions Act (1999 Act).
